hanzi-su-wiki:
拠

Значения

Основываться, опираться; основа, опора, неизбежность; хватать, зависеть

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Место 処 рукопашной 扌 схватки.

Варианты

據, 据

jù
Japanese variant of 据
Японский вариант
rtega_mnemonic:
據據RS
据据		拠occupy, take possession of, base, position, foothold
  • hand 扌 occupying a place 居/処 or base of a wild boar 豦
heisig_constituent: foothold, finger, fingers, dispose, walking legs, wind
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: точка опоры, на основе, следовать, поэтому
koohiiStory1: When rockclimbing, when your weight disposes of the valuble foothold, all that´s left is your fingers keeping you from death. Meanwhile, your walking legs are left dangling in the wind.
koohiiStory2: Once you have a good foothold, you can dispose of your fingerhold.
jp_example_words:
根拠(こんきょ): basis, foundation
証拠(しょうこ): evidence, proof
jp_readingExamples: 拠点 (きょてん), 占拠 (せんきょ), 根拠 (こんきょ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Wipe your fingers on this table in winter to see what it was based on. The cold winter weathers cover the table in frost, and when you wipe it away, you can see traces of what the table was originally based on. All tables have to be based on something, even if it's just other tables that came before them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine tracing your fingers over the table, the cold winter frost stinging them, as you reveal the secrets of this table and what it was based on.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This particular table was based on the design on Little Kyoto (きょ). You feel the little, cold designs that were inspired by Little Kyoto. There are tiny little temples and shrines carved into the table that you could only find this time of year.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The table was based on Little Kyoto, but it probably wasn't made there. What a shame.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hand (扌) you use to deal with (処) (things) is your basis

jù
яп. вм. 据
Radicals: 扌, 夂, 几  (fingers, winter, table)
Meaning Mnemonic
Wipe your fingers on this table in winter to see what it was based on. The cold winter weathers cover the table in frost, and when you wipe it away, you can see traces of what the table was originally based on. All tables have to be based on something, even if it's just other tables that came before them.
Imagine tracing your fingers over the table, the cold winter frost stinging them, as you reveal the secrets of this table and what it was based on.
Reading Mnemonic
This particular table was based on the design on Little Kyoto (きょ). You feel the little, cold designs that were inspired by Little Kyoto. There are tiny little temples and shrines carved into the table that you could only find this time of year.
The table was based on Little Kyoto, but it probably wasn't made there. What a shame.
